title: (x) American Eagle Outfitters corporate slab serif - AE Newburgh {Chris Keegan}
content:
Looking for this type. I’m terrible at serifs like this!

edit: whoops, wrong image. Here.. looks like Clarendon but not..

edit2: extracted text.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071221230420im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/aeholiday_4739.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071221230420im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/aeholiday2_4186.jpg)

 [‹ V Man Magazine thin geometric sans headline face](http://web.archive.org/web/20071221230420/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40150 "Go to previous forum topic") [Hand printed script - treated Comic Sans? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071221230420/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40156 "Go to next forum topic")
author: wizard7926

comments.content:
That looks like it.

Custom work for AE, not available, probably? :(

Anything strikingly similar?

I believe this is Matt Desmond’s custom typeface [AE Newburgh](http://web.archive.org/web/20071221230420/http:/www.madtype.net/ae_newburgh.html).

According to his website it is a Clarendon style, but with Garamond proportions.
